question:
Recently, India became a member of the “Australia Group” (AG). In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Australia Group is a multilateral export control regime (MECR) established in 1985
  2. With its entry to Australia Group, India became member of all the four existing non-proliferation treaties
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: First statement is correct. Australia Group is a multilateral export control regime (MECR) established in 1985. It aims to control the unchecked proliferation of materials, equipment and technologies that could contribute to the development or acquisition of chemical and biological weapons by states or terrorist groups. Second statement is incorrect. With India admitted to Australia Group (AG), it became a member of the three of the four non-proliferation regimes viz. Missile Technology Control Regime (MTCR), the Wassenaar Agreement (WA) and the Australia Group (AG). The only remaining is Nuclear Suppliers Group (NSG).
